item.title: Being A Mentor For Google Code-in
item.description: About Google Code-In Google Code-In is an one of a kind online contest where pre-university students (ages 13 to 17) are invited to take part and experience open-source development. They have a wide variety of byte-sized tasks from various participating organisations, easy for beginners to jump in and get started no matter what skills they have. What Do Mentors Do Mentors are the primary helping hands for the organisations. Mentors create tasks and look over their proper completion by the participants.
